class ollama_forge.cli.OllamaClient(base_url: str = DEFAULT_OLLAMA_API_URL, timeout: int = DEFAULT_TIMEOUT, max_retries: int = 3, session: requests.Session | None = None)[source]Â¶

Client for interacting with the Ollama API.

This class provides a comprehensive interface to all Ollama API endpoints, with support for both synchronous and asynchronous requests, streaming responses, and robust error handling.

base_urlÂ¶

Base URL for the Ollama API

timeoutÂ¶

Request timeout in seconds

max_retriesÂ¶

Maximum number of retries for failed requests

Initialize the Ollama client.

Parameters:

  • base_url â€“ Base URL for the Ollama API

  • timeout â€“ Request timeout in seconds

  • max_retries â€“ Maximum number of retries for failed requests

  • session â€“ Optional requests.Session to use

_with_retry(method: str, endpoint: str, data: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, stream: bool = False, headers: Dict[str, str] | None = None) → requests.Response | None[source]Â¶

Make an HTTP request with retry logic.

Parameters:

  • method â€“ HTTP method (GET, POST, etc.)

  • endpoint â€“ API endpoint to call

  • data â€“ Request data

  • stream â€“ Whether to stream the response

  • headers â€“ Optional request headers

Returns:

Response object

Raises:

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ConnectionError â€“ If connection fails after all retries

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ModelNotFoundError â€“ If the model is not found

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ServerError â€“ If the server returns a 5xx error

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.InvalidRequestError â€“ If the request is invalid

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.TimeoutError â€“ If the request times out

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.OllamaAPIError â€“ For other API errors

  • stream â€“ Whether to stream the progress

Returns:

If stream=True, a generator yielding progress updates If stream=False, a dictionary with pull result
